alert.note: Alert for Pasquotank (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Carolina, including the following county, Pasquotank. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is likely ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area during the next hour. Therefore, the advisory has been extended until 830 PM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabeth City, Weeksville, Elizabeth City State University, Bob White Fork and Symonds Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
